name: Anaxes
description: A rocky planet located in the Azure sector of the galaxy's Core Worlds region. A majority of its surface was covered with tall, red plant-like life. In the early years of the Imperial Era, the planet was destroyed in a cataclysm, with the remains becoming the Anaxes asteroid belt.

name: Abafar
description: A desert planet located in the Outer Rim with a completely white surface. Known as The Void, the planet is barely populated but is home to massive amounts of rhydonium, a scarce and volatile fuel.

name: Aeos Prime
description: An ocean planet located in the Outer Rim territories. Home to native Aeosians and the site of a former Rebel Alliance base.

name: Agamar
description: A barren, rocky planet in the Outer Rim. Site of a still-active reserve of Separatist droids that became known for surviving the Clone Wars.

name: Agamar
description: A barren, rocky planet in the Outer Rim. Site of a still-active reserve of Separatist droids that became known for surviving the Clone Wars.

name: Ahch-To
description: Oceanic planet on which Luke Skywalker has been hiding for several years, and the location of the first Jedi Temple and the Tree Library of sacred Jedi texts. Porgs are among the native species.

name: Ahch-To
description: Oceanic planet on which Luke Skywalker has been hiding for several years, and the location of the first Jedi Temple and the Tree Library of sacred Jedi texts. Porgs are among the native species.

name: Ajan Kloss
description: A jungle moon which serves as a new base of operations for the Resistance. Leia Organa dies here after using the last of her energy to reach out to her son through the Force.

name: Ajan Kloss
description: A jungle moon which serves as a new base of operations for the Resistance. Leia Organa dies here after using the last of her energy to reach out to her son through the Force.

name: Akiva
description: Jungle planet and home of Norra and Temmin Wexley, and a primary setting in Aftermath.

name: Alderaan
description: Forests, mountains; home planet of Princess Leia and the House of Organa. Destroyed by the first Death Star as punishment for involvement in the Rebel Alliance and also as a demonstration of power.

name: Alderaan
description: Forests, mountains; home planet of Princess Leia and the House of Organa. Destroyed by the first Death Star as punishment for involvement in the Rebel Alliance and also as a demonstration of power.

name: Alzoc III
description: Ice planet, with many glaciers, and in its surface lies a crashed separatist carrier, with an anti-gravitational device.

name: Ando
appearances: Star Wars Rebels: Head to Head
description: A water-covered planet located in the Outer Rim, it is home to the amphibious Aqualish species and endures great turmoil during the Separatist Crisis.

name: Anoat
description: Polluted; A nearly inhospitable planet used by the Empire.

name: Anoat
appearances: Star Wars Legends:Star Wars: Dark Forces
description: Polluted; A nearly inhospitable planet used by the Empire.

name: Anoat

name: Arvala-7
description: An "out-of-the-way" desert planet where the Mandalorian was sent by the Client to look for the Child and where Kuiil worked as a vapor farmer.

name: Atollon
description: Desert planet, site of Phoenix Squadron Rebel base. Home of the spider-like hexapods known as the Krykna, and the powerful force-wielder Bendu.

name: Batuu
description: A remote frontier outpost and old trading port

name: Balnab
description: A Barbaric world once visited by R2-D2 and C-3PO.

name: Bespin
description: A gas planet with a thin layer of habitable atmosphere where Cloud City was located. The planet's gas layers were a source of rare tibanna gas which was harvested and refined at mining complexes like Cloud City.

name: Bespin
description: A gas planet with a thin layer of habitable atmosphere where Cloud City was located. The planet's gas layers were a source of rare tibanna gas which was harvested and refined at mining complexes like Cloud City.

name: Bespin

name: Bogano
description: A hospitable planet where Eno Cordova hid from the Empire. There was a structure known as "The Vault", within which hid a Jedi holocron.

name: Bothweli
description: Site of a space battle between Anakin Skywalker and General Grievous.

name: Bracca
description: An inhospitable junkyard planet in the Mid Rim considered strategically important in the Clone Wars. Becomes useful to the Scrapper Guild whose members salvage decommissioned ships for the Empire.

name: Cantonica
description: An arid planet where the resort city of Canto Bight, home of the Canto Casino and Racetrack, is located.

name: Castilon
description: An ocean planet located in the Outer Rim near Wild Space. Home to the aircraft refueling station Colossus, as well as a destination for racers.

name: Cato Neimoidia
description: The site of battles throughout the Clone Wars, notable for its "Bridge Cities". Also the site of Plo Koon's death during the Great Jedi Purge.

name: Cato Neimoidia
description: The site of battles throughout the Clone Wars, notable for its "Bridge Cities". Also the site of Plo Koon's death during the Great Jedi Purge.

name: Celsor 3
description: An uninhabited ice moon and home to the Jakoosk.

name: Chandrila
appearances: Star Wars Legends:The Truce at Bakura
description: Homeworld of Mon Mothma, it serves as the first capital of the New Republic. Serene planet known for calm seas and rolling hills.

name: Chandrila
description: Homeworld of Mon Mothma, it serves as the first capital of the New Republic. Serene planet known for calm seas and rolling hills.

name: Christophsis
description: During the Clone Wars, the Battle of Christophsis occurs here, serving as an introduction to Ahsoka Tano.

description: Home planet of Jango Fett. Habitable planet that is surrounded by a large amount of debris from many vicious wars. Formerly controlled by the Mandalorians.

appearances: Star Wars Legends:Heir to the Empire
description: Cosmopolitan urban world consisting of one planet-wide city. Governmental center of the Galactic Republic and later the Galactic Empire.

name: Crait
description: Small mineral planet located in a remote section of the galaxy, its surface is covered with a layer of white salt over its red-colored soil. In Leia, Princess of Alderaan it is the location of an early Rebel Alliance outpost. Leia and her remaining Resistance forces flee there in The Last Jedi, where they face off with the First Order.

description: Homeworld of the Force-sensitive Nightsisters, including Asajj Ventress. Also the homeworld of the Zabrak warriors, including Darth Maul.

name: Eadu
description: Rocky, mountainous planet beset by constant severe storms. Home to an Imperial weapons research facility. Its appearance was partly inspired by the fictitious planet LV-426 from the Alien franchise.

name: Endor
description: Forest moon that the second Death Star orbits, and house to an Imperial outpost. Inhabited by Ewoks. The location of the battle between the Rebel Alliance and the Empire leading to the destruction of the second Death Star.

name: Er´kit
description: Desert planet located in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. Homeworld of the Er'Kit species.

name: Eriadu
description: Planet located in the galaxy's Outer Rim. Homeworld of Grand Moff Tarkin and his family.

name: Eriadu
description: Planet located in the galaxy's Outer Rim. Homeworld of Grand Moff Tarkin and his family.

name: Exegol
description: A stormy planet in the galaxy's "Unknown Regions". An ancient bastion of the Sith, it serves as the lair of Darth Sidious during the construction of his armada known as the Final Order.

name: Felucia
description: Jungle planet teeming with plants but little animal life. Aayla Secura is assassinated here during the Jedi Purge.

name: Florrum
description: Sulfurous desert planet. Hondo Ohnaka is the leader of a pirate gang based on the planet.

name: Fondor
description: Imperial manufacturing center with large shipyards.

name: Geonosis
description: Rocky desert planet where battle droids are manufactured, and the site of the opening battle of the Clone Wars. All life on the planet is presumed destroyed by the Empire in Star Wars Rebels, with two exceptions: Klik-Klak and his offspring. Primary construction site of the first Death Star. Homeworld of the Geonosians.

name: Geonosis

Homeworld of the Geonosians.

name: Iego
description: An Outer Rim planet which harbors flying creatures called xandu and medicinally important plants called reeska. Iego is surrounded by a 1000 moons and at least one of these, named Millius Prime, is home to a race called the Angels.

appearances: Star Wars Legends:Jedi Quest: Path to Truth
description: Remote ice planet where kyber crystals are mined. It became Starkiller Base.

name: Jakku
description: Desert planet. Site of a "graveyard" of ships damaged during the Battle of Jakku, the final battle between the New Republic and the Galactic Empire. Also the homeworld of Rey.

name: Jakku

name: Jedha
description: Cold desert moon, and a sacred place for believers in the Force. A source of kyber crystals used for lightsabers and the Death Star's primary weapon. It is also the first location on which the Death Star's destructive capability is tested. Rogue One's director, Gareth Edwards, has described the location as "a Mecca or Jerusalem within the Star Wars world". It is also a homonym for Jeddah, the principal gateway to Mecca.

name: Kamino
description: Ocean planet where cloning technology is developed and the Clone Army is created and trained. Obi-Wan Kenobi discovers that the planet is missing from the Jedi archives; it is later revealed to have been deleted as a part of Darth Sidious' plot to start the Clone Wars.

name: Kamino

name: Kashyyyk
description: Forest planet and home of the Wookiees. Also the site of one of the final battles of the Clone Wars.

name: Kef Bir
description: A moon of Endor and the location of some of the wreckage of the second Death Star after it was destroyed in Return of the Jedi.

name: Kessel
description: A mining planet that has been fought over by crime lords for its valuable Spice. A fissure vent beneath the spice mines served as a source of astatic coaxium, an element that could be refined into hyperfuel for starships.

name: Kijimi
description: A frigid mountainous planet. It was the homeworld of Zorii Bliss, leader of the smuggling gang known as the Spice Runners of Kijimi. It is later destroyed by the Final Order as a show of force for the rest of the galaxy.

name: Lira San
description: The original homeworld of the Lasat, according to Zeb Orrelios, member of the Spectres.

name: Lothal
description: Remote farm planet and birthplace of Ezra Bridger.

name: Lotho Minor
description: A planetary junkyard and hiding place of Darth Maul after his presumed death.

name: Malachor
description: Desolate Sith temple world and site of two major battles thousands of year apart: one involving the Scourge of Malachor, the other between Darth Maul, several Rebels, Darth Vader, and several Inquisitors.

name: Malastare
description: Forested planet where podracing is popular. Birthplace of Sebulba and homeworld of the Dug.

name: Maldo Kreis

description: Formerly habitable planet and the subject of legends due to its history of Mandalorian warriors.

name: Mon Cala
description: Ocean planet, home to the Mon Calamari and Quarren species. Also known as Mon Calamari, or Dac.

name: Moraband
description: Home planet of ancient Sith lords. Known as Korriban in Legends.

name: Mortis
description: Planet with a wall surrounding it, home to the three omnipotent Force wielders known only in the Jedi Archives as the Mortis Gods.

name: Mustafar
description: An originally lush and forested planet that becomes volcanic and almost lifeless during an ancient battle. The hiding place of the Separatists leaders during the final hours of the Clone Wars, until they are killed by Darth Vader, who is later permanently scarred in a battle with Obi-Wan Kenobi. During the Imperial era, Vader builds his personal fortress on the planet. Vader's grandson, Kylo Ren, retrieves a Sith wayfinder from the ruins of his grandfather's fortress decades later.

name: Pillio
description: Uncolonized aquatic planet with over 3 million species, and the location of one of Palpatine's observatories.

name: Polis Massa
description: Outer Rim planetoid within an asteroid field of the same name; birthplace of Luke Skywalker and Leia Organa.

name: Rishi

description: Tropical planet used by the Republic to monitor the nearby cloning facility on Kamino.

name: Rishi
description: Tropical planet used by the Republic to monitor the nearby cloning facility on Kamino.

name: Rodia
appearances: Star Wars Legends: Shadows of the Empire
description: Home planet of the Rodians, including Greedo. A remote swampy, jungle planet, it was represented by Onaconda Farr in the Galactic Senate during the Clone Wars.

name: Rodia
description: Home planet of the Rodians, including Greedo. A remote swampy, jungle planet, it was represented by Onaconda Farr in the Galactic Senate during the Clone Wars.

name: Rugosa
description: A moon that consists of giant coral reefs. Yoda meets King Katuunko of the Toydarians here.

name: Ruusan
appearances: Star Wars Legends: Star Wars Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II
description: Barren planet housing the Valley of the Jedi. Site of a great battle between the Sith and the Jedi.

name: Ruusan
description: Barren planet housing the Valley of the Jedi. Site of a great battle between the Sith and the Jedi.

name: Ryloth
appearances: Star Wars Legends: Tales from Jabba's Palace
description: Dry, hot home planet of the Twi'leks, including Hera Syndulla and Jedi Master Aayla Secura.

name: Ryloth
description: Dry, hot home planet of the Twi'leks, including Hera Syndulla and Jedi Master Aayla Secura.

name: Ryloth
description: Dry, hot home planet of the Twi'leks, including Hera Syndulla and Jedi Master Aayla Secura.

name: Saleucami
description: Primary terrain deserts and swamps. Home of the Clone Trooper deserter Cut Lawquane.

name: Saleucami
description: Primary terrain deserts and swamps. Home of the Clone Trooper deserter Cut Lawquane.

name: Savareen
appearances: Star Wars Legends:Star Wars Adventure Journal 9
description: Desert and ocean planet. where destitute villages farm wind and refine coaxium. In Solo: A Star Wars Story, the Millennium Falcon arrives there after Han and his crew steal coaxium from Kessel, and Dryden Vos and Tobias Beckett die there.

name: Savareen
description: Desert and ocean planet. where destitute villages farm wind and refine coaxium. In Solo: A Star Wars Story, the Millennium Falcon arrives there after Han and his crew steal coaxium from Kessel, and Dryden Vos and Tobias Beckett die there.

name: Scarif
description: Oceanic "paradise world" used for construction of the Death Star after Geonosis. When Rebel Alliance members raid the Imperial database from the secret base on one of its tropical islands, the secret base is destroyed to impede their escape with the Death Star plans.

name: Scarif
description: Oceanic "paradise world" used for construction of the Death Star after Geonosis. When Rebel Alliance members raid the Imperial database from the secret base on one of its tropical islands, the secret base is destroyed to impede their escape with the Death Star plans.

name: Serenno
appearances: Star Wars Legends: Darth Bane: Rule of Two
description: A planet in the Outer Rim Territories. Homeworld of Count Dooku.

name: Serenno
description: A planet in the Outer Rim Territories. Homeworld of Count Dooku.

name: Shili
description: Home planet of the Togruta, including Jedi Council member Shaak Ti and Ahsoka Tano.

name: Skako Minor
description: Home planet of Wat Tambor.

name: Sorgan
description: A forested backwater planet in the Outer Rim mostly populated by human farmers who harvest krill which is used to make spotchka, a popular drink on the planet. Local farmers are constantly attacked by Klatooinians.

name: Starkiller Base
description: Snowy planet of forested mountains converted by the First Order into a superweapon. Later destroyed by the Resistance and gave birth to a miniature star, which was named "Solo" as an homage to Han Solo, who was killed by his son Kylo Ren on the planet. It is the converted version of Ilum.

name: Subterrel
description: Mining planet mentioned by Dexter Jettster who spent time prospecting there. Located near Kamino, beyond the Outer Rim.

name: Sullust
description: A volcanic planet whose atmosphere was highly toxic forcing the native Sullustans to build technologically advanced subterranean cities. It was the base of Imperial factories and the SoroSuub corporation employed roughly half the population.

name: Sullust
description: A volcanic planet whose atmosphere was highly toxic forcing the native Sullustans to build technologically advanced subterranean cities. It was the base of Imperial factories and the SoroSuub corporation employed roughly half the population.

name: Takodana
description: Forest planet and site of Maz Kanata's castle. Neutral territory between First Order and Resistance.

name: Takodana
description: Forest planet and site of Maz Kanata's castle. Neutral territory between First Order and Resistance.

name: Tatooine
description: Desert planet and childhood home of Anakin Skywalker and Luke Skywalker. Location of Jabba the Hutt's palace.

name: Tatooine

name: Teth
description: During the Clone Wars, Jabba's son Rotta is abducted by the Separatists and brought to this planet. Anakin and Ahsoka Tano travel to Teth and rescue Rotta from Asajj Ventress.

name: Toydaria
description: Home planet of Watto and other Toydarians. Close to Nal Hutta.

name: Trandosha
appearances: Star Wars Legends: The Mandalorian Armor
description: Homeworld of the Trandoshan hunters. Close to Kashyyyk.

name: Trandosha
description: Homeworld of the Trandoshan hunters. Close to Kashyyyk.

name: Umbara
description: Planet with a thick, foggy atmosphere. Home to the Umbarans.

name: Utapau
description: Remote planet, covered in deep sinkholes and home to the Utai and Pau'ans. Site of General Grievous' defeat and a separatist base during the last days of the Clone Wars.

name: Vandor-1
description: Icy, mountainous planet that is the site of a Crimson Dawn train heist led by Tobias Beckett in Solo: A Star Wars Story.

name: Vardos
description: Imperial stronghold and home to Iden and Garrick Versio. One of the first targets of Operation: Cinder.

name: Wobani
description: A desolate wasteland and the site of an Imperial penal labor colony.

name: Wrea
description: A planet near an asteroid filed where Saw Gerrara raises Jyn Erso after her father was taken by the Empire.

name: Yavin
description: Gas planet with several moons, including Yavin 4.

name: Yavin 4
description: Forest moon and base for the Rebel Alliance.

name: Yavin 4
description: Forest moon and base for the Rebel Alliance.

name: Zeffo
description: A planet with many mountains and stormy weather. Featuring ancient ruins and tombs, imperial excavations, and a crashed Venator near a tomb.

name: Zygerria
description: A planet in the Outer Rim Territories home of the Zygerrian species. Zygerria was also known for a slave empire.
